intro: Hypochaeris serioloides, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields, and it produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Hypochaeris serioloides is an annual herb that can spread through seeds, often forming dense mats in suitable environments. Its leaves are alternate, rough to the touch, and have a distinctive yellowish underside.
